sentences.en: a painting that is pedestrian and unimaginative
sentences.cn: 乏味又缺乏想象力的画作

sentences.en: He was knocked down on a pedestrian crossing.
sentences.cn: 他在人行横道上被撞倒。

sentences.en: His style is so pedestrian that the book becomes a real bore.
sentences.cn: 他的文风十分平庸，那本书乏味至极。

sentences.en: I drove home contemplating my own more pedestrian lifestyle.
sentences.cn: 我开车回家，一路上思考着自己更为乏味的生活方式。

sentences.en: I traversed the narrow pedestrian bridge.
sentences.cn: 我走过狭窄的人行天桥。

sentences.en: In Los Angeles a pedestrian is a rare spectacle.
sentences.cn: 在洛杉矶很少见到步行者。

sentences.en: Ingrid was a walker, even in Los Angeles, where a pedestrian is a rare sight.
sentences.cn: 英格丽德是个步行者，即使在行人少见的洛杉矶也是如此。

sentences.en: More than a third of all pedestrian injuries are to children.
sentences.cn: 所有受伤的行人中有1/3以上是儿童。

sentences.en: Pedestrian zones mean that children can play in relative safety.
sentences.cn: 步行区域意味着孩子们可以在那里相对安全地玩耍。

sentences.en: Pedestrian's vehicle on the street is a lot in the rush hour.
sentences.cn: 高峰时刻,街上的行人车辆很多.

sentences.en: She was mown down on a pedestrian crossing.
sentences.cn: 她在人行横道上被撞死了。

sentences.en: The circumstances and events of his life were anything but pedestrian.
sentences.cn: 他一生经历的事情是很不平常的.

sentences.en: The city built a pedestrian overpass over the highway.
sentences.cn: 城里在公路上建了一座过街天桥.

sentences.en: The driver was slanging a pedestrian who had got in his way.
sentences.cn: 那司机破口大骂挡他的路的行人.

sentences.en: The lorry driver escaped unhurt, but a pedestrian was injured.
sentences.cn: 卡车司机安然脱险，但有一位行人受了伤。

sentences.en: The pedestrian stopped at the curbside.

trans.tran_en: ordinary and uninteresting and without any imagination
someone who is walking, especially along a street or other place used by cars
someone who is walking, especially along a street or other place used by cars
